GENERAL EXTENSION DIVISION
DEPARTMENT OF RADIO AND TELEVISION BROADCASTING
MINNEAPOLIS 14
November 14, 1962
Harold E. Hill, Administrative Vice President
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
1346 Connecticut Avenue N.W.
Washington 6, D. C.
Dear Harold:
I have just received the ballot for the election of an
individual member director, which I am returning under separate
cover.
The length of this ballot brings immediately to mind the
question: isn*t this getting a little out of hand? There are
so many nominations — as a matter of fact quite a number of
good ones — that how can anyone expect to receive a plurality
of the votes in less than six ballotings?
Do you have any bright ideas as to how the number of
nominations could be held down to some more manageable number?
Yours sincerely
Burton Paulu, Director
Radio and Television
